content.description: Follow the tips crack out the right side of the small cave. This is another quality moderate highball, but it does not have a great landing.
content.location: The big hole to the right of the OW marks the start. This line exits the hole on the right side.

content.description:
Similar to the

right variation

, this is a quality, steep V0-ish line with less-than-perfect landing ;)

Climb out the left side of the small cave but not as far left as the OW.
content.protection: A spotter might be a good idea.
content.location: It is just to the right of the obvious OW.

content.description:
Like

The Book of Sand

, this is another great short OW to learn/practice some wide technique. Like

BoS

, it can be climbed with face holds to minimze OW technique.

I would call it maybe 8+ in an old school kind of way.
content.protection: You could bring a #6 cam to TR it....
content.location: It is hard to miss if you hike up to the saddle and look west ;)

content.description: This is a good warm-up for the area. Climb the featured arete approximately 15' right of the main Magi Face.

This one may appeal to those V0 boulderers who are a little intimidated by the commitment needed for

The Gift of the Magi

. This nice face is still tall enough, though ;)

Follow nice crimps and edges slightly left, and you work up the clean face.
content.location: It is about 5' left of the obvious OW.

content.description: A big foot hold make the start unavoidably easy, but otherwise this highball climbs some nice, sustained crimps up the right side of the face.
content.protection: A pad is fine. This has a nice, flat landing.
content.location: It is on the tall face to the right of the big hole and to the left of the arete.
